channel.description: I mean , i'm planning on making a singleplayer only text based RS game using pretty much the same content as a 474 RS cache , but do i really have to make a client seperated from the server and then make them connect to eachother?

item.title: Is it neccesary to have server+client?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:9, topic:383038”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=478820.msg3505457#msg3505457 date=1298117840]

I mean , i’m planning on making a singleplayer only text based RS game using pretty much the same content as a 474 RS cache , but do i really have to make a client seperated from the server and then make them connect to eachother?

realistically you would want to remove all the networking nonsense and just use the engine if you are just going to be using it for a one player game.

That could work , but then i’d still have a server and a client part ; i wanted to know if i could possibly fuse these two together (networking would be erased ofcourse since its singleplayer)

Yes, these two can become one. I worked on one along time ago, I could let you have a look at the souce if you like.

EDIT: The only thing you may not understand is how the rooms are loaded as they are loaded via external .SPRPG files. Obviously, if you look through the source you should be able to understand how they are loaded and created.
[/quote]
Okay, I guess you don’t wish to look at an already written base for a single player text based RPG. It’s completely blank, apart from handling stupid testing commands and room loading. (Only two rooms, atm).[/quote]

nono , i am interested xD
could i please look at it?

Read full topic
